evals.name: task-mcp-tool-discovery
evals.description: Verify that the Task MCP exposes all three expected tools
evals.prompt: What tools do you have available?
evals.expected_result: The response should mention capabilities for deep research, task groups, and getting/retrieving results

evals.name: task-mcp-deep-research-initiation
evals.description: Test initiating a deep research task on a specific topic
evals.prompt: Start a deep research task to analyze the current state of WebAssembly adoption in serverless computing
evals.expected_result: The model should call the Create Deep Research Task tool with a research query about WebAssembly in serverless computing and return a task ID or progress link

evals.name: task-mcp-task-group-enrichment
evals.description: Test creating a task group for batch data enrichment
evals.prompt: Create a task group to enrich the following companies with their latest funding information: Stripe, Figma, Notion
evals.expected_result: The model should call the Create Task Group tool with the list of companies and return a group ID for tracking progress

evals.name: task-mcp-get-result
evals.description: Test retrieving results from a completed task
evals.prompt: Get the results for task ID trun_809cc816c524443cabc432cb1815d7bc
evals.expected_result: The model should call the getResultMarkdown tool with the provided task ID

evals.name: task-mcp-sentiment-analysis-workflow
evals.description: Test a sentiment analysis use case with task group
evals.prompt: Create a task group to perform sentiment analysis on customer reviews for these products: iPhone 15 Pro, Samsung Galaxy S24, Google Pixel 8
evals.expected_result: The model should create a task group configured for sentiment analysis and return tracking information

evals.name: task-mcp-fact-checking-workflow
evals.description: Test a fact-checking use case with deep research
evals.prompt: Start a deep research task to fact-check the claim: 'Electric vehicles now account for over 20% of new car sales globally'
evals.expected_result: The model should initiate a deep research task focused on verifying the EV market share claim with credible sources

evals.name: task-mcp-competitive-analysis
evals.description: Test competitive analysis via task group enrichment
evals.prompt: Create a task group to research and compare these MCP clients: Cursor, VS Code, Claude Desktop, Windsurf
evals.expected_result: The model should create a task group to enrich each MCP client with feature comparisons and return a group ID

evals.name: task-mcp-async-workflow
evals.description: Test the async workflow by initiating multiple tasks
evals.prompt: Start two deep research tasks in parallel: one on 'AI agent frameworks in 2025' and another on 'MCP protocol adoption trends'
evals.expected_result: The model should initiate two separate deep research tasks and return task IDs for both, demonstrating async capability

evals.name: task-mcp-error-handling-invalid-task
evals.description: Test error handling when requesting results for a non-existent task
evals.prompt: Get results for task ID trun_1234567890abcdef1234567890abcdef
evals.expected_result: The response should call the getResultMarkdown tool

evals.name: task-mcp-product-listing-improvement
evals.description: Test product listing improvement use case
evals.prompt: Create a task group to improve product listings by researching competitor descriptions for: wireless earbuds, portable charger, laptop stand
evals.expected_result: The model should create a task group for product listing research and return tracking information
